meanings.definition: A group of individuals or entities that are considered as a whole.
meanings.sent1: The collectivities of students worked together on the project.
meanings.sent2: The collectivities of animals in the forest create a diverse ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The collectivities of vegetables in the fridge decided to throw a party.
meanings.sent4: The collectivities of stars in the sky form beautiful constellations.
meanings.sent5: The collectivities of colors in the painting made it vibrant and eye-catching.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being collected or gathered together.
meanings.sent1: The collectivities of toys on the shelf made the room look cluttered.
meanings.sent2: The collectivities of clouds in the sky signaled an incoming storm.
meanings.sent3: The collectivities of socks in the drawer seemed to have a party of their own.
meanings.sent4: The collectivities of thoughts in her mind were overwhelming.
meanings.sent5: The collectivities of books on the shelf created a sense of knowledge and wisdom.
